segments.text: I am so grossed out by the water all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s just spreading everywhere, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is being so reckless, climbing on that stool like an animal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl is just standing there, waiting for cookies like it’s normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying the same plate over and over, and it’s just weird.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole scene is just wrong, and I can’t stand it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the boy is still grabbing more like a pig.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water dripping down the cabinets, and it’s making me sick.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just nasty, and I wish I could leave.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the garden outside is so nice, but inside, it’s a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to clean this mess up before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
